intro: Damburneya minima, commonly known as the dwarf damburneya, is a small evergreen shrub native to the eastern coast of Australia. It features narrow, dark green leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along its stems. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Damburneya minima is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in coastal gardens due to its salt tolerance.
